Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] The "new media types are evil" meme
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=479695541; y=mCT1XgCvUfg8-kxjD1QYNlPKA-WNPd-p40VE-rgh0MMzUcrdsms2GjHjRyq3KNtJVMg

Hi Markus,

at a first glance your referred papers are looking very promising. They 
remind me to a discussion we had appr. one year ago about the 
REST-i-ness of SPARQL (see [1]).
However, the problem with JSON-LD still is, that it doesn't utilise link 
relation types (as it is the same problem with all RDF serialisation 
formats ATM). In contrast, HAL makes use of link relations types 
("href", ...), and, hence, supports the HATEOAS constraint of REST.
So my solution proposal for this problem still is to design a vocabulary 
to describe link relation type definitions in a machine processable way 
and attach these definitions to our well-known RDF property definitions, 
i.e., then we have knowledge about the property (relation) itself and 
how it can be processed by a client.

Cheers,


Bo


[1] http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/rest-discuss/message/17281


On 1/8/2012 11:38 AM, Markus Lanthaler wrote:
> Mike, could you elaborate on what exactly makes HAL "much less
> convoluted than JSON-LD"?
>
> --
>
> Markus Lanthaler
>
> @markuslanthaler
>
> *From:*rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com
> [mailto:rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com] *On Behalf Of *Mike Kelly
> *Sent:* Sunday, January 08, 2012 5:44 PM
> *To:* Paul Cohen
> *Cc:* REST-Discuss Discussion Group
> *Subject:* Re: [rest-discuss] The "new media types are evil" meme
>
> On Sun, Jan 8, 2012 at 9:38 AM, Markus Lanthaler
> <markus.lanthaler@... <mailto:markus.lanthaler@...>> wrote:
>
> Paul Cohen wrote:
>  > Having said that, I would be satisifed with one single new media type;
>  > one that combines JSON:s simple expressiveness with native support for
>  > hyperlinks! :-)
>
> Have you had a look at JSON-LD? It offers much more than just support for
> hyperlinks but you could "abuse" it just for getting that:
> http://www.json-ld.org/spec/latest/json-ld-syntax/
>
> Hi Paul,
>
> If you only need links and embedding then HAL is much less convoluted
> than JSON-LD:
>
> http://blog.stateless.co/post/13296666138/json-linking-with-hal
>
> Cheers,
>
> Mike
